related-activity.ref: 2070/A0/05/002 OUTCOME 2 EDU EARLY CHLD & ADOLES DEVEL

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 2.2: Strengthened capacity of provincial governments to improve learning achievement of primary school children.

description.narrative: The early grade literacy model has continued to gain traction and be recognized as a successful replicable model to improve students' learning outcomes in remote and rural areas. Prior to the school closures due to COVID-19, the model had been incorporated into local governments' budgets and plans in eight districts. Besides, two new districts have since shown interest in the model and discussions are underway to implement it. The total number of schools that have implemented the program as of June 2020 is 233, contributing to improved learning for 20,698 students and enhanced capacities among 1,003 teachers and 166 principals. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:16/07/2020

title.narrative: Number of district replicate the EGL model using their own budget
Provincial and district governments in Papua and West Papua have plans, leadership and budget for improving literacy teaching and learning in early grades
Provincial and district governments in Papua and West Papua have plans, leadership and budget for improving literacy teaching and learning in early grades
Early grade literacy model replicated in/outside Papua and West Papua

actual.value: 2020:The model has been replicated in 233 schools in 8 districts. COVID-19 pandemic slowed the replication progress in 2020, but 2 additional districts have already shown interest and technical assistance is underway to replicate.

title.narrative: A model for improvement of literacy skills of children in grades 13 is ready for replication

actual.value: 2019:The EGL model has been tested in 6 districts and replication guides were produced for use by other districts. So far 8 districts are following the guides and benefiting from technical support to replicate it.

title.narrative: The formation of a learning coalition and the implementation of learning conferences

actual.value: 2020:A coalition for learning has been formed at the national level with UNICEF co-leading it. This body has been instrumental in Supporting the COVID-19 response coordination and response in education.

title.narrative: The revision and refinement of EGL advocacy kit and replication guideline
